questions.question: What is a Java Stream?
answers: A sequence of data elements supporting sequential and parallel aggregate operations
A collection of elements with no particular order
A mechanism for handling input and output operations
A design pattern used for event-driven programming

questions.question: Which of the following is a terminal operation in Java Streams?
What does the map() method do in Java Streams?
answers: Filters elements based on a predicate
Transforms each element to another object

questions.question: How do you convert a Stream into a List?
What is the main advantage of using parallel streams?
answers: Simplifies the syntax of stream operations
Enables stream operations to be processed in parallel for improved performance on multi-core processors
Guarantees the order of stream processing

questions.question: Which method is used to filter elements of a stream?
What does the reduce() method do?
answers: Performs a reduction on the elements of the stream using an associative accumulation function
Filters elements based on a predicate
Transforms each element to another object

questions.question: What is the difference between a sequential stream and a parallel stream?
answers: Sequential streams operate on a single thread, whereas parallel streams operate on multiple threads
Sequential streams can handle I/O operations, whereas parallel streams cannot
Sequential streams are used for file operations, whereas parallel streams are used for network operations
Sequential streams guarantee element order, whereas parallel streams do not

questions.question: Which method is used to sort elements in a stream?
What does the forEach() method do in Java Streams?
answers: Applies a function to each element in the stream
Transforms each element to another object
Filters elements based on a predicate
